q: David Cameron said he was ''very sorry'' Andy Coulson was going but added that he could ''understand that the continuing pressures on him and his family mean that he feels compelled to do so.'' Andy Coulson has told me that the focus on him was impeding his ability to do his job and was starting to prove a distraction for the government, he said. But the challenge on this magical journey is to stay relevant and fresh. And if you really want to remain white hot in the press- there's only one place to go. our northern border are exacerbating the gang-related violence in many communities across the state. This problem must be fought at its source.'' Kirsten Gillibrand , a member of the Senate Armed Services Committee, said, We need a commitment by Secretaries Janet Napolitano and Robert Gates to work with local communities along the border to make sure they have the resources to solve this problem and keep communities across the state safe from drug-related violence. at the White House the day after Woodward and Bernstein's first story about Watergate in the Washington Post, Donald Rumsfeld asserts he defied his colleagues and demanded to get to the root of the problem, saying, If any jackass across the street[ at campaign headquarters] or here had anything to do with this, he should be hung up by his thumbs today. Donald Rumsfeld is dismissive in his attitude to Colin Powell and Rice, whose decisions he constantly criticizes.
